sortpom.wrapper.operation

Class HierarchyWrapperOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • sortpom.wrapper.operation.HierarchyWrapperOperation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DetachOperation, GetContentStructureOperation, SortAttributesOperation, SortChildrenOperation, ToStringOperation

    public abstract class HierarchyWrapperOperation
extends Object
    This class gives a default implementation of an operation that traverse the xml hierarchy. The operation executes on each xml element recursively
    Since:
    2013-11-01
    Author:
    bjorn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HierarchyWrapperOperation() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HierarchyWrapperOperation createSubOperation()
      Override this if the operation wants to manipulate itself before it traverses down to the children of the element being processed
      void endOfProcess()
      Override this if the operation wants to do something after each element has been processed
      void manipulateChildElements(List<HierarchyWrapper> children)
      Override this if the operation want to manipulate the child elements of element being processed
      void processElement(Wrapper<org.jdom.Element> element)
      Override this if the operation wants to do something with the actual element being processed
      void processOtherContent(Wrapper<org.jdom.Content> content)
      Override this if the operation wants to do something with each 'other content' that belongs to the element being processed
      void startOfProcess()
      Override this if the operation wants to do something before each element has been processed

        public HierarchyWrapperOperation createSubOperation()
        Override this if the operation wants to manipulate itself before it traverses down to the children of the element being processed
        Returns:
        the same or another instance of the implementing operation
